planning_booking.tip: Check Semana Santa dates before booking hotels
Confirm Feria de Abril hotel availability early
Book Caminito del Rey slots online at caminitodelrey.info

transport.tip: Rent a car for white villages exploration
Use buses for short hops between cities
Download Moovit app for local buses
Take AVE high-speed train for speed
Avoid driving in Seville's old town - restricted zones
Refuel before rural drives - gas stations sparse in mountains

timing_seasons.tip: Lunch is 2-4 PM, dinner is 9-11 PM
Visit Alcázar at opening time (9:30 AM)
See Plaza de España at dawn for empty photos
Avoid Granada midday heat in summer - stay indoors
Travel spring/autumn for festivals and mild weather
Winter is mild but damp - pack layers
Summer evenings are best for walking - cooler after 8 PM
Check Córdoba Patio Festival dates in May
Visit Feria markets at night for atmosphere

accommodation.tip: Stay in boutique hotels for charm
Use rooftop pools in summer for siesta breaks
Book apartments for families - more space and kitchens
Stay in Carmona for cheaper lodging near Seville
Choose Triana neighborhood for authentic Seville vibe
Pick Albaicín area for Alhambra views in Granada
Stay near Plaza Nueva (Granada) for nightlife
Use Booking.com filters for hotels with patios
Check Airbnb for village stays in white villages
Reserve early for Easter week - prices triple

safety_comfort.tip: Watch for pickpockets in crowded tourist areas
Avoid driving narrow village streets - park and walk
Respect dress codes in churches - cover shoulders/knees
Use ATMs in banks, not street kiosks
Stay hydrated in summer - carry water bottle
Wear comfortable walking shoes - cobblestones everywhere
Avoid sandals on cobblestones - ankle hazard
Use insect repellent in rural areas evening

money_shopping.tip: Tapas are cheaper off tourist streets
Buy ceramics in Triana (Seville) - authentic and quality
Buy olive oil in Priego de Córdoba - best quality
Visit Cádiz fish market for fresh seafood
Use credit cards in cities, cash in villages
Carry coins for buses and small purchases
Avoid tourist traps near major landmarks

Seville.hack: Visit Alcázar at opening time (9:30 AM) to avoid crowds
See Plaza de España at dawn for empty photos
Explore Plaza del Cabildo hidden behind Cathedral
Visit Antiquarium ruins under Las Setas (Metropol Parasol)
Eat pringá montaditos at Bodeguita Antonio Romero
Join locals at Plaza de la Alfalfa for evening drinks
Drink at Plaza del Salvador evenings - local hangout
Try orange wine - unique to Seville
Visit Hospital de los Venerables for art
Explore Casa de Pilatos - less crowded than Alcázar

Córdoba.hack: Enter Mezquita via side streets for faster access
Visit patios in May during Patio Festival - many are free
Eat flamenquín at Taberna El Choto
Try rabo de toro at Taberna Salinas
Visit Palacio de Viana patios - 12 courtyards
Explore Medina Azahara ruins - 10km outside city
Eat berenjenas con miel (eggplant with honey) riverside
Drink vermouth in San Basilio neighborhood
Stay overnight for quieter Mezquita visits early morning

Granada.hack: Use free tapas tradition - order drinks slowly, tapas come free
Visit Mirador de San Nicolás at sunset for best Alhambra views
Eat piononos sweet pastries in Santa Fe nearby
Try remojón granadino (orange and cod salad) in Albaicín
Visit Carmen de los Mártires gardens - free entry, quiet
Attend flamenco in Sacromonte caves - authentic venue
Explore Albaicín alleys at night - magical atmosphere
Night visit to Alhambra in summer - cooler and magical
Visit Cuevas del Sacromonte museum for cave history

Ronda.hack: Visit Setenil de las Bodegas houses built into cliffs
Explore Olvera castle for panoramic views
Swim in Zahara de la Sierra reservoir
Hike Grazalema Natural Park - greenest in Spain
Taste local mountain wines from Ronda vineyards
Eat chivo al ajillo (goat in garlic sauce)
Visit Museo Lara for quirky collection
Walk Alameda del Tajo park for gorge views
Stay overnight for Puente Nuevo lit up at night
Visit Baños Árabes - best preserved Arab baths in Spain

Málaga.hack: Eat espetos de sardinas on beach - grilled on skewers
Visit Mercado de Atarazanas for fresh food and tapas
Relax at Hammam Al Ándalus spa
Visit Gibralfaro Castle at sunset for views
Drink Málaga sweet wine - local dessert wine
Walk Caminito del Rey early morning - cooler and less crowded
Visit El Palo beach for authentic sardine experience

Cádiz_Jerez.hack: Try atún rojo de almadraba (bluefin tuna)
Visit Cádiz fish market for seafood
Drink manzanilla sherry in Sanlúcar de Barrameda
Attend horse show at Royal Andalusian School in Jerez
Tour sherry bodegas - Tío Pepe, González Byass
Explore Arcos de la Frontera white village
Visit coastal seafood taverns in Cádiz
Stay for Carnival in February - biggest in Spain

lifestyle_hacks.hack: Order 'media ración' (half portion) to sample more dishes
Ask for 'menu del día' at lunch for budget meals (€10-15)
Stand at the bar for cheaper tapas prices
Visit local peñas (flamenco clubs) instead of tourist shows
Shop at municipal markets for authentic food
Buy pastries from convents - nuns sell homemade sweets
Use refillable water fountains in plazas
Join locals for evening paseo (stroll) after dinner
Visit rooftop bars for city views without crowds
Explore side-street taverns instead of main squares
